intro: Sticherus brevipubis, commonly known as the short-hairy sticherus, is a small, perennial liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant has a prostrate stem with closely spaced, leaf-like structures called phyllodes, which are usually arranged in two rows. Its reproductive structures, known as sporophytes, are small and develop on the upper surface of the leaves. Sticherus brevipubis is often used in ecological studies to assess the health of wetland and forest ecosystems due to its sensitivity to environmental changes.
